name: Whose Mic Is It Anyways?  Two Shots & One Open Mic
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Samyoga: Khayal se Kriti tak (unplugged)
description: Samyoga – Khayal Se Kriti TakA unique confluence of Hindustani and Carnatic musical traditionsSamyoga – meaning union or coming together – is an evocative musical production that intricately weaves together the rich threads of India’s two great classical traditions: Hindustani and Carnatic music. Conceptualised and presented by Dr. Radhika Joshi (Hindustani Vocal) and Manasi Prasad (Carnatic Vocal), Samyoga is a celebration of both the shared roots and the distinctive aesthetics of these traditions. This presentation of Samyoga will be an unplugged, voice-only exploration, where two voices come together, accompanied by live tanpuras to create an immersive and meditative musical experience.Traversing the expanse of Indian music, the concert explores genres ranging from the gravitas of classical forms to the devotional depth of Bhakti Sangeet, and from the emotive beauty of Thumri and Jawali to the dramatic expressiveness of Natyasangeet. Each piece is carefully curated to highlight both the convergence and divergence in approach, structure, and emotion across the two systems.Through a seamless blend of performance and narration, Samyoga offers audiences more than just a concert—it presents a musical journey, providing insights into the evolution, nuances, and interconnections between genres. Interestingly, both Radhika and Manasi are alumni of the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore, who chose to follow their hearts into the world of music. Today, they are recognised not only as accomplished performers but also as dedicated researchers in the field of Indian music.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation.This time, Doors, a homegrown social card game, will be featured! The game is designed to bring people together and enable meaningful conversation through play. Created as a response to our hyper-digital lives, it invites you to slow down and explore thoughtful questions, big ideas, and wholesome human connections. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter! Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event; we will only take photos with a camera. Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours!

name: Clay Magnets Workshop
description: Clay Magnets Workshop – A Fun and Creative Experience for All Ages!Step into a world of colour, imagination, and hands-on creativity at our Clay Magnets Workshop at Fired Up Studio! Whether you’re a seasoned crafter or a complete beginner, this workshop is a great way to unwind, explore a new medium, and make something unique and personal with your own hands.In this engaging 2.5-hour session, participants will learn to create charming, quirky fridge magnets using Shilpkar, a lightweight air-dry clay that’s easy to shape and perfect for beginners. Our experienced instructors will guide you through each step of the process—from shaping and sculpting the clay to painting and finishing your pieces.You’ll start by learning basic clay modeling techniques and how to work with miniature forms. Then, choose from a variety of fun designs or come up with your own ideas—animals, foods, emojis, flowers, or your favourite characters! After sculpting, we’ll show you how to add details using vibrant acrylic paints. Once dried, each piece will be fitted with a strong magnet so you can take home your finished creations, ready to display on your fridge or magnetic board.Each participant will make 3 to 4 magnets during the session, and all materials—including clay, sculpting tools, paints, brushes, and magnets—will be provided. You don’t need to bring anything except your creativity!What’s Included:Step-by-step guidance by a skilled instructorHands-on clay sculpting and paintingAll supplies and tools provided3 to 4 completed magnets to take homeFun, relaxed, and creative atmosphereWho Can Join:This workshop is open to ages 5 and above. It’s perfect for kids, adults, families, friends, or even colleagues looking for a unique team activity. Parents are welcome to join their kids in the session or work alongside them.Why You’ll Love It:Express Yourself: Create tiny works of art that reflect your personality.Learn Something New: Discover the basics of clay modeling and acrylic painting.Take a Break: Get away from screens and daily stress in a relaxing, artistic environment.Make Memories: Great for parent-child bonding, friend groups, or solo self-care.Whether you're looking to explore a new hobby, spend quality time with your child, or simply enjoy a creative afternoon, our Clay Magnets Workshop is a delightful and rewarding experience.Join us at Fired Up Studio and let your creativity come to life—one tiny magnet at a time!Duration: 2.5 hours Age Group: 5+ Materials: All included Location: Fired Up Studio, Bangalore Booking: Limited spots available—reserve yours

name: Bangalore Heritage Walk | 17th August 2025
description: Bangalore Heritage Walk Theme: Colonial Bangalore, Royal Legacy & Hidden Alleys Duration: 4–5 hours Start Time: 7:30 AM Ideal For: History buffs, architecture enthusiasts, culture seekers Group Size: Small (8–12 recommended)Price: Rs 2000/head📍 Start Point: St. Mark’s Cathedral7:30 AM – 8:00 AMBegin your walk at this iconic 200-year-old Anglican church.Learn about British-era architecture and Bangalore’s role as a garrison town.Don’t miss the beautifully carved woodwork and stained glass interiors.Tip: Meet at the gate; carry a bottle of water and wear comfortable shoes.🏰 Stop 2: Cubbon Park & Attara Kacheri (High Court)8:10 AM – 9:00 AMWalk through the lush green Cubbon Park, originally laid out in 1870.Pause at Attara Kacheri, the red-painted High Court building built in 1868 in neoclassical style.Hear stories about how Bangalore's legal and civic institutions were shaped here.🏛️ Stop 3: Vidhana Soudha Viewpoint9:05 AM – 9:20 AMA quick halt opposite Vidhana Soudha for a photo op and a brief on post-independence architecture.Discuss the transition from colonial to modern Indian governance.🏯 Stop 4: Bangalore Fort (Kempe Gowda Fort Remains)9:45 AM – 10:15 AMHead to the remnants of the 16th-century fort built by Kempe Gowda, founder of Bangalore.Learn about the original mud fort, Hyder Ali’s renovations, and British conquest.Transport Tip: Short auto ride or cab recommended from Cubbon Park to the Fort area.🕌 Stop 5: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace10:20 AM – 11:00 AMAdmire Indo-Islamic architecture and ornate teakwood interiors.Dive into Tipu Sultan’s legacy, battles with the British, and resistance stories.🍵 Closing: Breakfast Stop at a Heritage Café11:10 AM – 12:00 PMWind down with a traditional Karnataka breakfast at MTR (Lalbagh Road) or Vidyarthi Bhavan (Basavanagudi).Great place to reflect, chat and enjoy some filter coffee and dosas.📝 What to CarryWater bottleSunglasses/capComfortable walking shoesID proof (for palace entry)Camera/phone for photos

description: What if play wasn’t a break from learning but the heart of it?Join us for The Playbook, Papagoya’s flagship 1-day play experience that brings together leading minds in education, design, and neuroscience to challenge how we think about play in Indian learning spaces.This isn’t a celebration of play for play’s sake; it’s a call to redesign our classrooms, curriculums, and mindsets around one of the most powerful tools for cognitive, emotional, and social development: Play.Explore how storytelling, food, architecture, and even AI can spark curiosityParticipate in hands-on mini-courses that reimagine learning through the sensesWhether you're an educator, designer, policymaker, or parent, this day is for anyone who believes that the future of learning must start with joy.Limited seats available. name: Rethinking What's Next: Realigning with Purpose
description: Are you living with choice, meaning, and purpose?So often, our dreams and aspirations get buried in the everyday rush.This workshop offers you the space to pause, listen inward, and realign with what matters most.Take the pause now. Begin shaping what’s next. Facilitator: Ragini RaoJoin her in this offline workshop to:Reflect on what drives youRethink patterns that no longer serveMap your way forward with clarity and confidenceRagini Rao is a Teaching and Supervising Transactional Analyst TSTA(P). She trains and supervises advanced training groups in Transactional Analysis to become Psychotherapists, Coaches and Trainers. With over 5000 hours of one-on-one and group counselling and therapy, over a span of 30 years, she has addressed problems pertaining to Relationships, Marital Issues, Depression, Grief, Low Self Esteem and Sexual, Verbal and Physical Abuse. Ragini is also a licensed workshop leader for the “Heal your Life” programs based on the philosophy of world renowned author Louise L. Hay. She conducts the Heal Your Life workshops in offline settings.

name: Listening to Your Body: Move with Ease & Awareness
description: What if staying active isn’t about pushing harder, but about listening better?This gentle, movement-based workshop is designed to help you reconnect with what your body truly needs right now. Whether you're going through a life change, feeling stuck in old habits, or simply want to feel more at ease in your body, this session offers a calm, supportive space to slow down, move with awareness, and reset.Led by Sandeep Selvakumar, a movement coach who helps people live with less pain and more ease, the session will include simple practices to help you:Notice what your body is trying to tell youUnderstand how your needs around sleep, food, and energy are changingLet go of outdated ideas about exercise and fitnessShift from “doing more” to “feeling more present”It’s a chance to reset, reflect, and learn simple ways to care for your body every day.What You’ll Experience:Gentle, guided movement and body-awareness practicesThoughtful partner conversationsTools to help you check in with your body daily"Ask Me Anything" with Sandeep — come with questions!Sandeep helps people move with ease and feel good in their bodies again. He works especially with people who’ve had long-term pain or stress in their body. His approach combines movement, psychology, and everyday habits to help you build a better relationship with your body, without pressure or judgment.

name: Coro Commons - A slower kind of bazaar
description: Welcome to Coro Commons!A new kind of community gathering. A slower kind of bazaar.Coro Commons is our way of opening up the Coro spirit to everyone with a vibrant, one-day gathering where stalls, stories, and shared experiences come together under one roof. While it may look like a market, it’s more than that. This is a space to create, connect, and be, with hands-on experiences for both kids and adults, playful interactions, creative expressions, and yes, some beautiful things to take home too.We’re thrilled to be hosting Merchants of Happiness - India’s first-ever child-led pop-up - built on the belief that children are not just the future, but the present. Over the past two years, MOH has worked with over 600 children across schools and NGOs, co-creating joyful, inclusive spaces where children aged 7 to 21 lead their own stalls, offering everything from food and books to pre-loved toys, DIY stations, and delightful performances.Though Coro is a space that celebrates parents and families, Coro Commons is for everyone. Whether you’re coming with a little one in tow, on your own, or with a friend, you’ll find something that sparks joy, curiosity, or a new connection. And in the spirit of truly welcoming families, all kids walk in free - no age limits, no exceptions.We’re not here to sell stuff. We’re here to gather with purpose—to make space for mess, meaning, and a little magic.This isn’t just a bazaar. This is Coro Commons. Let’s gather differently.At Coro, we also care deeply about sustainability. In that spirit, we gently encourage you to take public transport where possible. While we don’t have dedicated parking, there’s ample space to park on the street if you choose to drive in.

description: Welcome to a different kind of weekend. ✨One where art, music, technology, and mindful community aren’t forced — they emerge naturally 🌱 from the simple act of sharing space and intention.The space? A beautiful 6-acre permaculture farm on the southern outskirts of Bangalore 🌿.The premise is simple:On Friday, three teams of five artists arrive at the farm 🎨.They have 24 hours to make digital art 💻.Then, on Saturday, you and a few dozen others arrive for an afternoon of relaxation, mindful workshops, and delicious food ☀️🧘‍♀️🍲.In the evening, the art is presented and the winning team is crowned 🏆.Then comes the all-night fire session — with dancing, music, and impeccable company 🔥🪩🌙.This is a flower unlike any other from the Garden City —A space where everyone feels like a friend you haven’t met yet, and the story is whatever you want it to be. 🌸

name: Movie Under the Stars | In the Mood for Love
description: Join us for an open-air screening of celebrated director Wong Kar-wai's  In the Mood for Love (2000), with a three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron and popcorn. *Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movie:Set in 1960s Hong Kong, a love story like no other, In the Mood for Love explores the quiet ache of unspoken love and missed chances through syrupy cinematography, atmospheric music, and masterful direction.Maggie Cheung and Tony Leung play two neighbors who form a deep connection after suspecting their spouses of infidelity. As they grow closer, they struggle with their feelings and moral boundaries. A love story told not in words, but in the spaces between them.Paired with a thoughtfully curated three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron inspired by lonely hearts, neon nights, and the taste of things lost and found, this is a night made for quiet reflection, shared plates, and a little cinematic magic under the night sky. 3-course dinner by Chef Rhea AaronCourse 1:Wonton soup (spinach and shiitake filling)Course 2 :Braised Tofu and Mushroom in Oyster SauceORSteamed Chicken in Black Bean Sauce (both served with rice)Course 3 :5-spiced Chocolate Mousse with a Berry JamTerms and ConditionsThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Limited Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. name: Hands Full, Hearts Full: Floral Styling Workshop
description: Step into a world of blooms, creativity, and connection at Coro’s hands-on floral styling workshop; open to kids, parents, and adults of all ages. Learn the art of crafting your own bouquet from beautiful, seasonal flowers, guided by an expert who’ll help you play with colour, texture, and style.And because no creative session is complete without great food, we’re pairing the workshop with a delicious grazing table for both kids and adults to enjoy. Think fresh bites, sweet treats, and plenty of time to chat, snack, and admire each other’s floral masterpieces.Come solo, with your child, or bring a friend - leave with your own gorgeous bouquet (or more!), a happy belly, and maybe even a new connection.Hands Full, Hearts Full is our new series of hands-on workshops designed to spark creativity, teach new skills, and bring people together. From craft to cooking, each session is about making something real, all while making real connections. This is just the beginning. In the months ahead, Hands Full, Hearts Full will bring you more opportunities to try your hand at something new, feed your curiosity, and connect with others in ways that last long after the workshop ends.

name: Tajurba - A Sarangi Jugalbandi
description: Tajurba: Sarangi Jugalbandi ft. Ustad Dilshaad Khan & Arhaan KhanAccompanied by Trilochan Kampli on TablaAugust 16 | Independence Day Special EditionThis Independence weekend, immerse yourself in the soul of India through the hauntingly beautiful strains of the sarangi—an instrument once central to our classical traditions. Tajurba presents a rare jugalbandi between the legendary Ustad Dilshaad Khan, whose compositions have graced both stage and screen, and his 16-year-old son Arhaan Khan, making his much-awaited debut.Joined by Trilochan Kampli—the master tabla accompanist and curator of Tajurba—this evening is a tribute to the inheritance of sound, tradition, and artistic legacy.Come celebrate freedom by returning to our roots. Experience a revival of Indian classical music that speaks not just to the past, but to the future.

name: Sitar Recital with Samanwaya Sarkar | Baithak
description: Note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday morning.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistSamanwaya Sarkar is the first ever recepient of the Bravo Awards from Russia as Indian Classical Artist is a renowned sitarist celebrated for his exceptional performances and mastery in traditional Indian classical music. Recognized with the National Award and the President’s Award, Samanwaya has also earned an A grade from All India Radio and Doordarshan.Samanwaya has performed extensively across India at prestigious venues and festivals, including Swar Mangesh Festival (Goa), Sawai Gandharva Sangeet Mahotsav (Pune), and Saptak (Ahmedabad), Swar Samrat Festival (Bangalore).His international presence includes performances at the Sitar Festival (Russia), Sharq Taronalari International Music Festival (Uzbekistan), and WOMAD (UK), Elbphilharmonie (Germany), Theatre De La Ville (Paris), Mananan International Music Festival (Isle of Man), Sitar Festival (Russia) etc.Terms and Conditions1. name: Screening Before Sunrise (1995)-Richard Linklater
description: Join us over the long weekend for special screening of Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004) on Friday and Saturday night at Underline Center!What is the Before series?Richard Linklater’s trilogy of Before Sunrise, Before Sunset, and Before Midnight tells the heartfelt, surprising tale of the joys and pains of modern love.The films, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, follow the evolving relationship of Jesse and Celine over a period of 18 years. Each film is set about nine years apart, capturing different stages of their lives and relationship. It's widely considered one the greatest film trilogies, and is notable for its extensive use of dialogue, with conversations driving the narrative and exploring themes of love, time, and relationships. The films are characterized by long, intimate conversations between the main characters, which often delve into their thoughts, feelings, and philosophies.

name: Oota & Aata: Edition 3
description: 'Travel back in time to peaceful simple evenings with friends & family' 'It was a really fun and engaging event. The hosts were attentive and the food was great.'Oota & Aata is an intimate, hyper-local event series that invites people to pause, gather, and play like we used to — back in the day.A curated experience set in Sabha inspired by balmy Bangalore’s late afternoons, games your ajji loved paired with comforting tea-time snacks inviting a slower kind of joy.Oota & Aata Edition 3Oota & Aata invites you to explore a range of traditional board games that may stir up a childhood memory or pique your curiosity to learn something new!Recreate the memory of a childhood home where slow weekend evenings were spent in playful exploration with loved ones, as you choose from one of the games like Alaguli Mane/Pallanguzhi, Pagade, Aadu Huli/ Tiger & Goat to explore.The event will also feature snack platters inspired by authentic South Indian tea-time snacks like vadais, Mangalore buns, kuzhipaniyarams and ambient music to elevate the experience. Gather your game-night crew, a friend or come solo for an evening of playful (could get competitive) fun and discovery!This time, Oota & Aata will take place over 2 sessions. We have a morning slot (10:30am-1pm) and evening slot (4-6:30pm). Please choose your slot accordingly.About SabhaSabha is imagined as a cultural space housed in a meticulously restored 160-year-old CVS Sabha school, part of the RBANM's Educational Charities legacy. Envisioned as a hub for the arts, ideas, and community, Sabha is a place where heritage meets contemporary expression.About Roll The DiceRoll The Dice is dedicated to reinventing the experience of playing traditional Indian board games. These games are most enjoyable and beneficial when played by people across generations, offering memory boosts, sharper thinking, relaxation, and improved cognitive skills.Please note - Event is only for ages 5+. Ticket is mandatory for all ages.

description: We’re Third Space Collective — a community that creates intentional spaces for people to connect, play, and unwind outside of work and home. Our experiences are limited edition, screen-free, and designed to bring strangers together over shared joy and a little bit of friendly competition.Our next edition? Level Zero – Press Start to Play Level Zero is a fast-paced, non-alcoholic game day where arcade energy meets minute-to-win-it chaos. We’ll kick off with the Speed-Meet Arcade—a whirlwind of 30-second rapid conversations to meet fellow players and collect your starting “lives” — before diving into five escalating game levels.Each round brings a new single-player challenge that gets trickier as you go. Lose a life? Respawn by buying one back at our stall and jump straight back in.We will end with the Final Showdown, where the last contenders face off for bragging rights and a SKOL gift hamper.📍 Fosite, Indiranagar📅 23 August, Saturday⏰ 11 AM to 1 PMCome ready to play, laugh, and maybe get a little competitive—because at Level Zero, every second counts.See you there! name: Frames of Confidence
description: Frames of Confidence - Celebrating Every Child’s Unique VisionWhere: Healthland Clinic, WhitefieldWhen: Sunday, August 24th, 11:00 am to 1:00 pmAge: 4 to 12 yearsA Morning of Stories, Fun and Learning for Children and Parents!Wearing glasses is not just about seeing clearly – it is about being seen, heard, and celebrated for who you are. Frames of Confidence is a fun and inspiring event designed to help children embrace their glasses with pride. Through games, creative activities, and a special read-aloud of the book Putti Gets Glasses, we will show young participants that their frames are part of their personality and style.Alongside the fun, we are hosting an insightful panel discussion featuring an ophthalmologist and a pediatrician. They will share valuable perspectives on children’s vision health, the emotional journey of wearing glasses, and practical tips for building confidence from an early age.Parents, educators, and caregivers will have the opportunity to ask questions, learn about eye care, and discover ways to support children in feeling proud of their individuality. Together, we will celebrate not just the power of clear vision, but also the strength, style, and spirit that every child brings to the world.What to Expect: 1. Story CornerSnuggle in for an interactive storytelling session of the book Putti Gets Glasses by the author herself - Dr. Maithri Arunkumar.2. Fun eye-based activitiesLet your child go wild at our art station where they can show off their unique style, get creative, and explore their imagination. These activities are designed to foster sensory exploration, self-direction, and shared play.3. Expert led Panel DiscussionParticipate in a thought provoking panel discussion in which experts will discuss the emotional impact of wearing glasses, body-image, self-confidence and personality.3. Join the First ADDA community. It takes a village. Welcome to ours. Meet other likeminded parents, kids, community spaces and brands who are creating a mindful, value aligned childhood ecosystem.

name: Half-day Someone | A tarot card reader
description: 🔮 Step into the World of a Tarot ReaderWhat’s it like to live a day in the life of a tarot reader? In this half-day experience, you’ll get a front-row seat to the world of tarot and oracle cards — not as a deep study, but as a playful, eye-opening journey into how these tools can offer guidance in everyday life.You’ll learn simple, practical tips that even non-readers can use, watch the magic of a live reading unfold, and try your hand at interpreting cards in fun, low-pressure exercises.What you’ll doMeet & GreetMeet your host – Maria.Hear stories from her journey as a professional tarot reader.Break the ice with a light-hearted intuition game.Behind the CardsDiscover the difference between tarot and oracle decks.Peek into how readers connect with the cards and set the tone for a reading.Learn a few universal symbols that anyone can spot in a card.Everyday TarotSee how a simple spread can be used for clarity on everyday choices - from travel plans to relationship crossroads.Pair up for playful “practice pulls” with guidance from Maria.The Reader’s MindsetStep into the intuitive, open-minded approach that makes readings insightful.Ask Maria anything about the art, challenges, and joys of being a reader.✨ What You’ll Leave With:•	A glimpse into the daily life of a tarot reader•	Fun, easy techniques to connect with cards (even if you’ve never touched a deck)•	A fresh perspective on using intuition for decisions•	Stories, insights, and a memory-making experience to take home

name: Screening Before Sunset (2004) - Richard Linklater
description: Join us over the long weekend for special screening of Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004) on Friday and Saturday night at Underline Center!What is the Before series?Richard Linklater’s trilogy of Before Sunrise, Before Sunset, and Before Midnight tells the heartfelt, surprising tale of the joys and pains of modern love.The films, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, follow the evolving relationship of Jesse and Celine over a period of 18 years. Each film is set about nine years apart, capturing different stages of their lives and relationship. It's widely considered one the greatest film trilogies, and is notable for its extensive use of dialogue, with conversations driving the narrative and exploring themes of love, time, and relationships. The films are characterized by long, intimate conversations between the main characters, which often delve into their thoughts, feelings, and philosophies.

name: S Aishwarya & S Saundarya - Carnatic Duo
description: Experience an evening of Carnatic music steeped in legacy and grace, as S. Aishwarya and S. Saundarya—granddaughters of the iconic M. S. Subbulakshmi—take the stage at Ram’s Musique Experience.Trained from childhood by their grandmother Radha Viswanathan and deeply inspired by their great-grandmother’s artistry, Aishwarya and Saundarya have performed at prestigious venues across India and abroad, including recreating the historic 1966 United Nations concert. Their performances are marked by fidelity to tradition, expressive depth, and a rare sense of devotion.Join us on August 24th at 7pm for an intimate concert at our vinyl record store on MG Road, and witness a living lineage of Carnatic music in its purest form.
